did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: James A. Glass thesis research papers, 1914-1983.
did.physdesc: Photographs, maps, reports, architectural plans, printed materials, correspondence, and publications.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection includes photographs and negatives, maps, reports, blueprints, articles, pamphlets, brochures, maps, a city plan, letters and clippings concerning Kingsport, Tennessee, Venice, Florida, and Mariemont, Ohio; minute books of the board of directors of the Mariemont Company and of the trustees of the Thomas J. Emery Memorial. Also, tapes and transcripts of interviews with architect and city planner Earle S. Draper, Sr., conducted by James Glass.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: James Glass received his M.A. in History of Architecture and Urban Development (Cornell University, 1984). His research on John Nolen focused on Kingsport, Tennessee, Mariemont, Ohio and Venice, Florida.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection includes photographs and negatives, maps, reports, blueprints, articles and clippings concerning Kingsport, Tennessee and Mariemont, Ohio; minute books of the board of directors of the Mariemont Company and of the trustees of the Thomas J. Emery Memorial, Cincinnati, Ohio; and material concerning Venice, Florida, including pamphlets, brochures, maps, a city plan, clippings and letters. Also, tapes and transcripts of interviews with architect and city planner Earle S. Draper, Sr., conducted by James Glass, May 14, l983 and December 17, 1983. Topics discussed include John Nolen and the planning of Kingsport, Tennessee. Transcript of interview with John Nolen, Jr. conducted by James Glass on December 13, 1983.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: City planning -- United States.
Community development.
New towns -- United States -- Case studies.
City planners.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: Photocopies of Mariemont, Ohio material owned by the Cincinnati Art Museummay not be used in a published work without permission ofthe Mariemont Preservation Foundation.
Transcripts of Earle S. Draper, Sr. interviews:written permission of Earle S. Draper, Sr. required to cite, quote or reproduce.
Tape recordings of Earle S. Draper, Sr. interviews:quotations may not be made from tape recordings; they may only be made from revised transcripts.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: James Arthur Glass, Collector. Thesis Research Papers, #4080. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
